tests.sic.sST.poisson

Class sSTCpoisson

  • java.lang.Object
    • tests.sic.sST.poisson.sSTCpoisson
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, FunctionIntf
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    sSTCpoissonBoxed

    public class sSTCpoisson
extends java.lang.Object
implements FunctionIntf
    function implements the continuous-time long-run expected cost of a periodic review, single echelon inventory control system facing exogenous demands generated in a period of length T, from a Poisson process with parameter λ. The system faces linear holding and backorder costs with cost rates h>0 and p>0 (and also possibly a 2nd one-shot penalty p2≥0 that applies as a fixed cost if a shortage occurs when placing an order and is otherwise independent of the length of delay in delivering the order). It also faces fixed costs: fixed review cost per period Kr≥0, and fixed order cost Ko≥0. Finally, there is a constant lead-time for each order being placed equal to L≥0. The control parameters then, are s (the reorder point), S (the order-up-to point), and T (the review interval). When fully optimized in all its control parameters, this is the globally optimal control policy and the resulting cost is the best possible cost of such an echelon (result known since the 50's by Arrow et al.)

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2020

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou
    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • eval

        public double eval(java.lang.Object x,
                   java.util.HashMap param)
        evaluate the long-run expected cost of a single echelon inventory control system facing Poisson demands with linear holding and backorder costs and fixed review and order costs controlled by (s,S,T) periodic review policy.
        Specified by:
        eval in interface FunctionIntf
        Parameters:
        x - double[] representing s, S and T or DblArray1Vector
        param - HashMap if not null, it may contain value for the Kr parameter
        Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - unchecked if the computations go awry, see method evalBoth(x).

      • evalBoth

        Pair evalBoth(java.lang.Object x,
              java.util.HashMap param)
        evaluate the long-run expected cost of a single echelon inventory control system facing normal demands with linear holding and backorder costs and fixed review and order costs controlled by (s,S,T) periodic review policy. It returns in a pair of doubles, both the actual value as well as the value when the order cost Ko is zero, forming a lower bound on the cost function.
        Parameters:
        x - double[] or popt4jlib.DblArray1Vector representing s, S and T
        param - HashMap // may contain a <"Kr",$val> pair
        Returns:
        utils.Pair // Pair<Double result, Double lowerbound>
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - unchecked if Po is computed outside [0,1] or if any number computed turns out to be Double.NaN.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        invoke as java -cp <classpath> tests.sic.sST.poisson.sSTCpoisson <s> <S> <T> <Kr> <Ko> <L> <μ> <h> <p> [p2(0)]. The constraints on the variables and parameters values are as follows:
        • s,S integer, S≥s
        • T>0
        • μ≥0
        • h>0
        • p>0
        • p2≥0
        All other parameters must be non-negative.
        Parameters:
        args - String[]
